Detailed Description

template<bool t_bManaged>
class WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >

???.

This class encapsulates the functionality of a Windows graphics device interface (GDI) brush, which is a bitmap that is used to fill the interior of closed shapes. To use a CBrushT object, construct a CBrushT object and pass it to any CDCT method that requires a brush.

Definition at line 167 of file atlgdi.h.

Parameters:

template<bool t_bManaged>
WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >::~CBrushT (    )  [inline]
 

Destructor.

If the instance is of type CBrush, then the brush handle is destroyed. If the instance is of type CBrushHandle, then nothing is done.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HBRUSH WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >::CreateBrushIndirect (  const LOGBRUSH *    lpLogBrush )  [inline]
 

Creates a brush.

This method initializes a brush with a style, color, and pattern specified in a LOGBRUSH structure. You can select the brush as the current brush for any device context.

Parameters:
lpLogBrush  Pointer to LOGBRUSH structure.
Returns:
The handle of the new brush. NULL if it fails.

Definition at line 219 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >::m_hBrush.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HBRUSH WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >::CreateDIBPatternBrush (  const void *    lpPackedDIB,
UINT    nUsage
)  [inline]
 

Creates a brush.

This method initializes a brush with the pattern specified by a device-independent bitmap (DIB). You can select the brush for any device context that supports raster operations.

Parameters:
lpPackedDIB  Identifies a global-memory object containing a packed DIB.
nUsage  Specifies whether the bmiColors fields of the BITMAPINFO data structure, a part of the packed DIB, contain explicit RGB values or indexes to the currently realized logical palette.
Returns:
The handle of the new brush. NULL if it fails.

Creates a brush.

Creates a hatched brush.

References WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >::m_hBrush.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HBRUSH WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >::CreatePatternBrush (  HBITMAP    hBitmap )  [inline]
 

Creates a brush.

This method initializes a brush with a pattern specified by a bitmap. You can select the brush for any device context that supports raster operations.

Parameters:
hBitmap  Bitmap to use in the new brush.
Returns:
The handle of the new brush. NULL if it fails.
Remarks:
The bitmap identified by hBitmap is typically initialized by using the CBitmapT::CreateBitmap, CBitmapT::CreateBitmapIndirect, CBitmapT::LoadBitmap, or CBitmapT::CreateCompatibleBitmap function.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HBRUSH WTL::CBrushT< t_bManaged >::CreateSysColorBrush (  int    nIndex )  [inline]
 

Creates a brush.

This method initializes a brush color. You can select the brush as the current brush for any device context.

Parameters:
nIndex  Specifies a color index. This value corresponds to the color used to paint one of the 21 window elements. See the Windows function GetSysColor for a list of values.
Returns:
The handle of the new brush. NULL if it fails.
